verb.description: Acknowledge (a significant or happy day or event) with a social gathering or enjoyable activity.
examples: they were celebrating their wedding anniversary at a restaurant
she celebrated with a glass of champagne

verb.description: Perform (a religious ceremony) publicly and duly, in particular officiate at (the Eucharist)

examples: a film celebrating the actor's career

origin: Late Middle English (in celebrate (sense 2)): from Latin celebrat- celebrated, from the verb celebrare, from celeber, celebr- frequented or honored.
